Elem.Name: ConditionPhrase
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the operational condition.

Elem.Name: Value
Elem.Doc: A numerical value with qualifier that quantifies (associates a value) the condition phrase.

Elem.Name: ConditionPhrase
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the operational condition.

Elem.Name: Value
Elem.Doc: A numerical value with unit and qualifier that quantifies (associates a value) the condition phrase.

Elem.Name: ConditionPhrase
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the operational condition.

Elem.Doc: Defines the Life Cycle Stage (formulation, industrial use, professional use, consumer use, service life consumer, service life worker) as defined in rule 1.

Elem.Doc: Describes the sector of use (SU) considered by the calculation of the structured short title for an exposure scenario as defined in rule 2.

Elem.Name: SSTMarketInformationSectorOfUseCodes

Elem.Name: SSTAdditionalInformation

Elem.Name: SSTMarketInformationArticleCategory

Elem.Name: SSTMarketInformationArticleCategoryCodes
Elem.Doc: Values for printing AC codes, as intended by the author of the Structured Short Title.

Elem.Name: Duration

Elem.Name: FlowRateRcvSurfWater
Elem.Doc: Specifies the water flow rate (receiving surface water) in m³/d into which the effluent is discharged; the default value is 18,000 m³/d. Expected value: Numeric value

Elem.Name: OutdoorIndoorActivity
Elem.Doc: Specifies whether the process or the activity takes place indoor or outdoor. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: MeasurePhrase
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the risk management measure.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessDermalInPercent
Elem.Doc: Specifies the degree in % to which the measure to prevent skin exposure is effective.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessInhalationInPercent
Elem.Doc: Specifies the degree in % to which the measure to prevent inhalation-related exposure is effective.

Elem.Name: OutdoorIndoorActivity
Elem.Doc: Specifies whether the process or the activity takes place indoor or outdoor. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Doc: Specifies whether the assessment has been done assuming professional or industrial settings. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Doc: Specifies the exposure route for which the exposure level has been measured or calculated. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: HealthEffect
Elem.Doc: Specifies the effect on the considered route caused by the exposure to the substance (or product). Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: ShortLongTermIndicator
Elem.Doc: Specifies the kind of exposure, for example short term or long term exposure. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: ExposureLevel
Elem.Doc: Specifies the exposure level value measured or calculated for the human route associated to it. Expected value: Numeric value

Elem.Name: CalculationMethod
Elem.Doc: Specifies how the exposure level is calculated for the human exposure route associated to it. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: RCR
Elem.Doc: Specifies the risk characterization ratio (RCR) of the value of the exposure level. It is obtained for every route by comparing the exposure level to the derived no-effect level (DNEL). Expected value: Numeric value

Elem.Name: ESSectionSubHeader
Elem.Doc: An enumeration that defines the heading within section 2 of the exposure scenario for communication to which the condition or measure is assigned.

Elem.Name: Type
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the type of an operational condition or a risk management measure.

Elem.Name: ConditionMeasure
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the condition of use or the risk management measure.

Elem.Name: NumericValue
Elem.Doc: A numerical value with unit and qualifier that quantifies (associates a value) the condition phrase.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessDermalInPercent
Elem.Doc: Describes the degree in % to which the measure against risk through skin exposure is effective.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessInhalationInPercent
Elem.Doc: Describes the degree in % to which the measure against risk through inhalation is effective.

Elem.Name: ConditionMeasure
Elem.Doc: Additional conditions related to human health that do not fall under any other attribute, but which are relevant for the overall characterization of the use of the substance (or product) and therefore have to be communicated in the supply chain. Expected value: Phrase or numeric value or both

Elem.Name: ExposureType
Elem.Doc: Specifies the exposure of the type of release to the environmental compartment, i.e. whether the releases are "continuous" or "intermittent".

Elem.Name: EmissionDaysPerYear
Elem.Doc: Specifies the number of days in a year during which the emission occurs.

Elem.Name: ESSectionSubHeader
Elem.Doc: An enumeration that defines the heading within section 2 of the exposure scenario for communication to which the condition or measure is assigned.

Elem.Name: Type
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the type of an operational condition or a risk management measure.

Elem.Name: ConditionMeasure
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the condition of use or the risk management measure.

Elem.Name: NumericValue
Elem.Doc: A numerical value with unit and qualifier that quantifies (associates a value) the condition phrase.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessAirInPercent
Elem.Doc: Describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release to air is effective.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessSoilInPercent
Elem.Doc: Describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release to soil is effective.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessWaterInPercent
Elem.Doc: Describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release to water is effective.

Elem.Doc: Describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release to waste is effective.

Elem.Doc: Release route to which the release rate reported refers. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Doc: Release rate value for the release route specified. Expected value: Numeric value

Elem.Name: ReleaseEstimationMethod
Elem.Doc: Describes the method used to determine the initial release of a substance to the environment from a process or during an activity. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: Compartment
Elem.Doc: Specifies the compartment, for example air, freshwater, freshwater sediment, or soil to which the exposure level reported refers to.

Elem.Name: ExposureLevel
Elem.Doc: Specifies the exposure level value measured or calculated for the environmental compartment associated to it.

Elem.Name: CalculationMethod
Elem.Doc: Describes the method used to determine the exposure level value.

Elem.Name: RCR
Elem.Doc: Specifies the risk characterization ratio (RCR) for the value of the exposure level. It is obtained for every compartment by comparing the exposure level to the predicted no-effect concentration (PNEC).

Elem.Name: MeasurePhrase
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the risk management measure.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessAirInPercent
Elem.Doc: Specifies the measure and the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release to air is effective.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessSoilInPercent
Elem.Doc: Specifies the measure and the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release to soil is effective.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessWaterInPercent
Elem.Doc: Specifies the measure and the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release to water is effective.

Elem.Name: MeasurePhrase
Elem.Doc: A phrase that describes the operational condition.

Elem.Name: EffectivenessInPercent
Elem.Doc: Describes the effectiveness of sewage treatment conditions. Specifies the value in a percentage of a substance which is removed from waste water by the sewage treatment plant.

Elem.Name: STPType
Elem.Doc: Specifies the type of sewage treatment plant that is used to treat the waste water from the activities covered by the exposure scenario before their release to the environment. The value of effectiveness specifies the value in a percentage of a substance which is removed from waste water by the sewage treatment plant. Expected value: Phrase (+ effectiveness)

Elem.Name: STPTypeAdditionalInformation
Elem.Doc: Specifies additional technical details on the type of treatment applied in the plant.

Elem.Name: SludgeTreatment
Elem.Doc: Specifies the way in which the sludge coming from the sewage treatment is processed or cannot be used.

Elem.Name: STPEffluentInM3perDay
Elem.Doc: Specifies the flow rate of the sewage treatment plant in m³/d. The default value used for a standard town is 2000 m³/d.

Elem.Name: ConsumerProtection
Elem.Doc: Indicates safety advice to be conveyed to consumers in order to reduce exposure. This may include instructions for use.

Elem.Name: OutdoorIndoorActivity
Elem.Doc: Specifies whether the activity takes place indoor or outdoor. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: RoomSize
Elem.Doc: Specifies the size of the room in which an activity takes place. Expected value: Phrase or numeric value or both

Elem.Name: TemperatureInCelsius
Elem.Doc: Specifies the temperature in °C at which an activity takes place. Expected value: Phrase or numeric value or both

Elem.Name: VentilationCondition
Elem.Doc: Specifies the ventilation conditions of the room in which an activity takes place. Expected value: Phrase or numeric value or both

Elem.Name: IdentificationString
Elem.Doc: Describes the global unique identifier that is generated by the system and that identifies the contributing scenario for the worker. Expected value: UUID

Elem.Name: ContributingScenarioName
Elem.Doc: Name that describes the contributing scenario for workers. Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: ContributingScenarioOrder
Elem.Doc: Specifies the order of a contributing scenario within the annex of the extended safety data sheet. Expected value: Order number

Elem.Name: AmountsOfUse
Elem.Doc: Describes the amount(s) of a substance used during a process or task. Specifies the period for the input amount used during a process or an activity. Expected value: Phrase or numeric value or both

Elem.Name: ExposureEstimationAdditionalDetails
Elem.Doc: Includes additional information for the downstream users beyond the numerical estimates and releases, e.g. related to the scope and details of the exposure assessment.

Elem.Name: UseAmount
Elem.Doc: Describes the amount(s) of a substance used during a process or task. Specifies the period for the input amount used during a process or an activity. Expected value: Phrase or numeric value or both

Elem.Name: AdditionalDetails
Elem.Doc: Includes additional information for the downstream users beyond the numerical estimates and releases, e.g. related to the scope and details of the exposure assessment.

Elem.Name: Sperc
Elem.Doc: SpERC = Specific Environmental Release Category. The phrase text is expected to hold the wording, the phrase OriginalCode is expected to hold the SpERC code.

Elem.Name: EnvironmentalReleaseCategory
Elem.Doc: Describes the environmental release categories that are covered by the assessment described in the specific contributing scenario. This description is made via the Use Descriptor System defined in chapter R.12 of the ECHA guidance on information requirements.

Elem.Name: WasteRelatedMeasures
Elem.Doc: Indicates how waste produced during a process or an activity should be treated, including, for instance, prescribed disposal methods or advised against treatment methods. Value expected: Phrase (+ effectiveness)

Elem.Name: AdditionalConditionsMeasuresEnvironment
Elem.Doc: Specifies additional waste related measures for a use relevant to environment.

Elem.Name: WasteTreatment
Elem.Doc: Indicates how waste produced during a process or an activity should be treated, including, for instance, prescribed disposal methods or advised against treatment methods. Value expected: Phrase (+ effectiveness)

Elem.Name: ConditionMeasure
Elem.Doc: Specifies additional waste related measures for a use relevant to environment.

Elem.Name: ReleaseDischargePrevention
Elem.Doc: Specifies different measures that aim to prevent losses from processes and/or clean up the streams (water or air) leaving the processes on site. The measures could be compartment-specific and could be associated with the specific effectiveness for air, soil or water. The effectiveness describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release is effective. Expected value: Phrase (+ effectiveness)

Elem.Name: Measure
Elem.Doc: Specifies different measures that aim to prevent losses from processes and/or clean up the streams (water or air) leaving the processes on site. The measures could be compartment-specific and could be associated with the specific effectiveness for air, soil or water. The effectiveness describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the release is effective. Expected value: Phrase (+ effectiveness)

Elem.Name: HumanFactors

Elem.Name: BodyPartsExposed

Describes the process categories that are covered by the assessment described in the specific contributing scenario. This description is made via the Use Descriptor System defined in chapter R.12 of the ECHA guidance on information requirements.

Elem.Name: TechnicalOrganizationalMeasuresWorkers
Elem.Doc: The equipment-related implemented to prevent the exposure of workers are indicated here. Organizational measures are also included in this field. The measures could be route-specific and could be associated with the specific effectiveness for dermal or inhalation. The effectiveness describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the exposure is effective. Expected value: Phrase (+ effectiveness)

Elem.Doc:
Indicates elements related to personal protective equipment (PPE) for workers. The measures could be route-specific and could be associated with the specific effectiveness for dermal or inhalation. The effectiveness describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the exposure is effective.

Elem.Name: Measure
Elem.Doc: The equipment-related implemented to prevent the exposure of workers are indicated here. Organizational measures are also included in this field. The measures could be route-specific and could be associated with the specific effectiveness for dermal or inhalation. The effectiveness describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the exposure is effective. Expected value: Phrase (+ effectiveness)

Elem.Name: Measure
Elem.Doc:
Indicates elements related to personal protective equipment (PPE) for workers. The measures could be route-specific and could be associated with the specific effectiveness for dermal or inhalation. The effectiveness describes the degree in % to which the measure to reduce the exposure is effective.
Expected value: Phrase (+ effectiveness)

Elem.Name: Sced
Elem.Doc: SCED = Specific Consumer Exposure Description. The phrase text is expected to hold the wording, the phrase OriginalCode is expected to hold the SCED code.

Elem.Name: ArticleCategory
Elem.Doc: Describes the article categories (AC) that are covered by the assessment described in the specific contributing scenario. The list of ACs is available in the Use Descriptor System defined in chapter R.12 of the ECHA Guidance on Information Requirements and Chemical Safety Assessment.

Elem.Name: ArticleSubCategory
Elem.Doc: Describes the article sub-categories that are covered by the assessment described in the specific contributing scenario, where additional details with respect to what is included in the field for ACs are needed.

Elem.Name: ProductCategory
Elem.Doc: Describes the product categories (PC) that are covered by the assessment described in the specific contributing scenario. The list of PCs is available in the Use Descriptor System defined in chapter R.12 of the ECHA Guidance on Information Requirements and Chemical Safety Assessment.

Elem.Name: ProductSubCategory
Elem.Doc: Describes the product sub-categories that are covered by the assessment described in the specific contributing scenario, where additional details with respect to what is included in the field for PCs are needed.

Elem.Name: IdentificationString
Elem.Doc: Specifies the global unique identifier that is generated by the system when generating an exposure scenario.

Elem.Name: VersionDate
Elem.Doc: Describes the version date of an exposure scenario in XML date format; the version date and the IdentificationString indicate changes or updates to an exposure scenario.

Elem.Name: ExposureScenarioName
Elem.Doc: Title of the exposure scenario.

Elem.Name: LifeCycleStage
Elem.Doc: Stage of the life cycle of the substance (or product) to which information communicated in the ES refer.

Elem.Name: MainUserGroup
Elem.Doc: Specifies the main user groups in the life cycle of a substance (or product) as key descriptor (SU 3, 21, 22).

Elem.Name: ExposureScenarioOrder
Elem.Doc: Specifies the order of an exposure scenario within the annex of the extended safety data sheet.

Elem.Name: SectorOfUse
Elem.Doc: Describes the sectors of use (SU) that apply to an exposure scenario with the aim to give information on the scope, e.g. in which markets the product is used or in which the activity takes place. The list of SUs is available in the Use Descriptor System defined in chapter R.12 of the ECHA Guidance on Information Requirements and Chemical Safety Assessment.

Elem.Name: MarketInformationProductCategory
Elem.Doc: Describes the product categories (PC) that apply to an exposure scenario to give information on the scope, e.g. in which product(s) the substance is used. The list of PCs is available in the Use Descriptor System defined in chapter R.12 of the ECHA Guidance on Information Requirements and Chemical Safety Assessment.

Elem.Name: MarketInformationArticleCategory
Elem.Doc: Describes the article categories (AC) that apply to an exposure scenario to give information on the scope, e.g. in which articles(s) the substance is used or ends up in. The list of ACs is available in the Use Descriptor System defined in chapter R.12 of the ECHA Guidance on Information Requirements and Chemical Safety Assessment.

Elem.Name: UseMapUseCode
Elem.Doc: see https://echa.europa.eu/documents/10162/15669641/use_maps_guidance_en.pdf/dade8654-e7e7-4e50-9721-1ddfe003179e , page 7. The code required here is to specify the unique identifier for each use in the use map, not a code for the whole use map. For example, a use in AISE’s use map has the identifier AISE_IS_001_v1, which follows the rules contained in the guidance mentioned.

Elem.Name: GuidanceToDU
Elem.Doc: Provides information that helps downstream users to evaluate whether they are working within the boundaries set by the exposure scenario.

Elem.Name: GuidanceText
Elem.Doc: Provides information that helps downstream users to evaluate whether they are working within the boundaries set by the exposure scenario.

Elem.Name: LeadPrioritySubstance
Elem.Doc:
Specifies whether a component in a mixture is a priority or a lead substance.
Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: ExposureScenario
Elem.Doc: Exposure Scenario information, originally based on Cefic's ESCom project

Elem.Name: Type
Elem.Doc:
Specifies whether a component in a mixture is a priority or a lead substance.
Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: Hazard
Elem.Doc:
Provides the exposure pathway in case of a lead substance or the type of a priority substance.
Expected value: Phrase

Elem.Name: SumiReference
Elem.Doc: Leave empty if the Sumi is not published by a chemical sector association and part of Use Map activities (no company specific SUMI codes here!). First word should be the sector name, e.g. AISE or FEICA, followed by the sector's SUMI code.

Elem.Name: GeneralDescription
Elem.Doc: Reference to the Sector-specific Worker Exposure Description as named in the sector's Use Map.

Elem.Name: OperationalConditions
Elem.Doc: Maximum duration of the use/application.

Elem.Name: GoodPracticeAdvice
Elem.Doc: In Exposure Scenarios, also known as AGPA = Additional Good Practice Advice

Elem.Name: DisclaimerBoundaries
Elem.Doc: Describes the boundaries of the SUMI. Mandatory according to some sources, optional according to others.

Elem.Name: SectorSumiCode
Elem.Doc: Leave empty if the Sumi is not published by a chemical sector association and part of Use Map activities (no company specific SUMI codes here!). First word should be the sector name, e.g. AISE or FEICA, followed by the sector's SUMI code.

Elem.Name: VersionNumber
Elem.Doc: Version number is optional here because SUMI info is part of the eSDS which is versioned, so the version date is expected to be the same and is sufficient to determine a sector SUMI version.

Elem.Name: SwedReference
Elem.Doc: Reference to the Sector-specific Worker Exposure Description as named in the sector's Use Map.

Elem.Name: Properties
Elem.Doc: Maximum duration of the use/application.

Elem.Name: MaxDuration
Elem.Doc: Maximum duration of the use/application.

Elem.Name: AirExchangeRate
Elem.Doc: Air exchange rate (equals VentilationRate in ESCom XML) is a minimum value.

Elem.Name: HazardClassCategory
Elem.Doc: CLP hazard category: The hazard class and a corresponding category / differentiation according to CLP.

Elem.Name: HazardClassCategoryPrintable
Elem.Doc: Printable, phrase based representation of HazardClassCategory. While this may be identical to HazardClassCatgory in its string representation, it provides a translated version linked to a phrase library for applications where this is useful.

Elem.Name: ClpAtp12HazardClassification
Elem.Doc: The chemical’s individual hazard classifications according to EU regulation 1272/2008, revised until and including EU regulation 2019/521, based on GHS revision 7.

Elem.Name: ClpAtp
Elem.Doc: Describes which amendment of CLP the ClpHazardClassification (and the labelling) is compliant with. Especially useful if the SDS revision date allows to classify according to different ATPs. This is not rudundant with the classification or labelling nodes, which are only referring to the ATPs that adapt CLP to new GHS revisions, while other ATPs may still change harmonized classifications.

Elem.Name: Classification
Elem.Doc: CLP classification procedure: To state how the individual classification is prepared. (This information should be shown in section 16). Only relevant for instances of type Classification in section 2. For components in section 3, this info should not be part of the SDS.

Elem.Name: MultiplyingFactor
Elem.Doc: Multiplying factor for substances highly toxic to the environment. Part of the classification of pure substances. The M factors are used in application of summation method for classification of mixtures containing substances that are classified as very toxic. The concept of M factors has been established to give an increased weight to very toxic substances when classifying mixtures.

Elem.Name: SpecificConcLimit
Elem.Doc: As provided by a harmonized classification or the supplier for dilutions of the substance/product. There is not just one SCL per hazard class, so this cannot be bound to such classes.

Elem.Name: ClpSupplementalHazardInformation
Elem.Doc: Supplemental Hazards are treated in CLP as labelling elements, but in fact are assessed like other classifications. For mixtures, supplemental hazards of ingredients need to be known to determine supplemental hazards of the mixture. Thus, systems can duplicate the information available as labelling here. See also https://github.com/esdscom/sdscom-xml/issues/229

Elem.Name: ClassificationNotes
Elem.Doc: Classification notes: To identify classification notes (letters and/or figures) in the case that the trade product is a substance. This information shall be stated in the SDS together with the classifications of the substance.

Elem.Name: ClassificationProcedure
Elem.Doc: CLP classification procedure: To state how the individual classification is prepared. (This information should be shown in section 16). Only relevant for instances of type Classification in section 2. For components in section 3, this info should not be part of the SDS.

Elem.Name: MinPercentage
Elem.Doc: always interpreted as greater than or equal to the value

Elem.Name: MaxPercentage
Elem.Doc: always interpreted as less than (not equal) to the value. If omitted, max percentage is 100.

Elem.Name: PhraseId
Elem.Doc: eSDScom (= EuPhraC, ESCom) phrase ID. Optional because user phrases and other phrase catalogues are allowed.

Elem.Name: PhraseId
Elem.Doc: eSDScom (= EuPhraC, ESCom) phrase ID. Optional because user phrases and other phrase catalogues are allowed.

Elem.Name: PhraseId
Elem.Doc: eSDScom (= EuPhraC, ESCom) phrase ID. Optional because user phrases and other phrase catalogues are allowed.

Elem.Name: LabellingAccordingToOtherEuLegislation
Elem.Doc: Other elements of the hazard label in accordance with EU legislation: Labelling required by other EU legislation

Elem.Name: ClpAtp12HazardLabelling
Elem.Doc: Labelling according to EU regulation 1272/2008, revised until and including EU regulation 2019/521, based on GHS revision 7.

Elem.Name: ClpAtp14HazardLabelling
Elem.Doc: Labelling according to EU regulation 1272/2008, revised until and including EU regulation 2020/217, based on GHS revision 7. Transition period: until 9 September 2021.

Elem.Name: HazardPictogram
Elem.Doc: Pictogram: A graphical presentation that includes a symbol plus other graphic elements, such as a border, background pattern or colour that is intended to convey specific information on the hazard concerned.

Elem.Name: SignalWord
Elem.Doc: Signal word: A word that indicates the relative level of severity of hazards to alert the reader to a potential hazard.

Elem.Name: HazardStatement
Elem.Doc: Hazard statement: A phrase assigned to a hazard class and category that describes the nature of the hazards of a hazardous substance or mixture, including, where appropriate, the degree of hazard.

Elem.Name: PrecautionaryStatement
Elem.Doc: Precautionary statement: A phrase that describes recommended measure(s) to minimise or prevent adverse effects resulting from exposure to a hazardous substance or mixture due to its use or disposal.

Elem.Name: SupplementalHazardInformation
Elem.Doc: Supplemental information on the label: Statements shall be included in the section for supplemental information on the label where a substance or mixture classified as hazardous has the physical properties or health properties referred to in sections 1.1 and 1.2 of Annex II of CLP. E.g. EUH001, EUH203, EUH401, etc.

Elem.Name: SpecialSupplementalLabelInfoMixtures
Elem.Doc: Special supplemental labelling information: Labelling requirements according to REACH Annex XVII.

Elem.Name: AdditionalLabellingInfo
Elem.Doc: Additional information, CLP labelling: Information for instance on labelling of combined user and transport packing (with reference.to Section 14 of the SDS).

Elem.Name: TactileWarning
Elem.Doc: Tactile Warning: To inform if packaging must be supplied with tactile warning if the chemical is supplied to the gerneral public

Elem.Name: ChildResistantOpening
Elem.Doc: Child Resistant Fastening: To inform if the packaging must be supplied with such fastening if the chemical is supplied to the general public.

E.g. EUH001, EUH203, EUH401, etc.

Elem.Name: ChildResistantOpening
Elem.Doc: Child Resistant Fastening: To inform if the packaging must be supplied with such fastening if the chemical is supplied to the general public.

Elem.Name: VocLabelling
Elem.Doc: VOC Labelling: Labelling requirements according to directive 2004/42/EC (amending 1999/13/EC)

Elem.Name: DetergentLabelling
Elem.Doc: Detergent labelling: Labelling requirements according to detergents regulation (648/2004/EC with later amanedments). Includes dosing recommendations. Concentration groups: _lt 5 weight%, 5 - _lt 15 vekt%, 15 - _lt 30 weight%, og _ge 30 weight%.

Elem.Name: AerosolLabelling
Elem.Doc: Aerosol labelling: Labelling of aerosol dispensers in accordance with EU directive (75/324/EEC with later amendments)

Elem.Name: OtherEuLabellingRequirements
Elem.Doc: Other labelling requirenments in accordance with EU legislation: Labelling requirements imposed to the chemical in accordance with EU legislation not stated above.

Elem.Name: ProductSubcategory
Elem.Doc: Product Subcategory: The type of paint or varnish

Elem.Name: VocLimitForSubcategory
Elem.Doc: Maximum VOC content limit for the mixture: The maximum concentration of VOC in the actual product. To begiven i gram per litre.

Elem.Name: MaxVocConcInMixture
Elem.Doc: Actual max. concentration in the mixture: The concentration of VOC in the mixture. To begiven i gram per litre.

Elem.Name: OnLabel
Elem.Doc: Name of the component to be displayed on the hazard label: The value "True" for this means that the name of the actual component shall be printed on the hazard label as well as in section 2 of the SDS under the sub-heading 'Dangerous substances'�. The default value of this element will be 'false'�.

Elem.Name: EuRestrictions
Elem.Doc: Restrictions related to the component: Specific regulations or restrictions that apply to the component.

Elem.Name: DerivedNoEffectLevel
Elem.Doc: Derived no effect level (DNEL): Where a Chemical Safety Report is required, the relevant DNELs for the substance shall be given. For preparations, it is useful to provide values for those constituent substances which are required to be listed in the safety data sheet.

Elem.Name: PredictedNoEffectConcentration
Elem.Doc: Predicted no effect concentration (PNEC): Where a Chemical Safety Report is required, the relevant PNECs for the substance shall be given. For preparations, it is useful to provide values for those constituent substances which are required to be listed.

Elem.Name: EuropeanWasteList
Elem.Doc: European waste list: EU classification of waste.

Elem.Name: EuWasteRegulations
Elem.Doc: EU legislation: EU legislation related to waste that applies to the product or its packaging.

Elem.Name: EWLProduct
Elem.Doc: European waste list for the product: Identification number (EWL No.) and description of the waste under the actual EWL No.

Elem.Name: EWLPacking
Elem.Doc: European waste list for the packaging: Identification number (EWL No.) and description of the waste under the actual EWL No.

Elem.Name: AdrRid
Elem.Doc: UN number ADR and RID:

Elem.Name: Adn
Elem.Doc: UN number ADN:

Elem.Name: UnNo
Elem.Doc: UN number ADR and RID:

Elem.Name: ProperShippingNameEnglish
Elem.Doc: Content should be in English language - see issue #13

Elem.Name: ProperShippingNameNational
Elem.Doc: Content should be in the language of the SDS - see issue #13

Elem.Name: DangerReleasingSubstanceEnglish
Elem.Doc: Content should be in English language - see issue #13

Elem.Name: DangerReleasingSubstanceNational
Elem.Doc: Content should be in the language of the SDS - see issue #13

Elem.Name: Class
Elem.Doc: ADR and RID hazard class: The chemical’s most important transport hazard class.

Elem.Name: OtherInformation
Elem.Doc: may have a value like "500 mL or 500 g"

Elem.Name: AdrRidLimitedQty
Elem.Doc: may have a value like "500 mL or 500 g"

Elem.Name: AdrHazardIdentificationNo
Elem.Doc: also known as Kemler code

Elem.Name: UnNo
Elem.Doc: UN number ADN:

Elem.Name: ProperShippingNameEnglish
Elem.Doc: Content should be in English language - see issue #13

Elem.Name: ProperShippingNameNational
Elem.Doc: Content should be in the language of the SDS - see issue #13

Elem.Name: DangerReleasingSubstanceEnglish
Elem.Doc: Content should be in English language - see issue #13

Elem.Name: DangerReleasingSubstanceNational
Elem.Doc: Content should be in the language of the SDS - see issue #13

Elem.Name: ClassCode
Elem.Doc: There are a few cases in class 9 without a code. Leave empty then.

Elem.Name: OtherInformation
Elem.Doc: may have a value like "500 mL or 500 g"

Elem.Name: LimitedQty
Elem.Doc: may have a value like "500 mL or 500 g"

Elem.Name: EuLegislation
Elem.Doc: EU legislations: Restrictions and other regulatory requirements related to the chemical in accordance with EU legislations.

Elem.Name: NationalLegislation
Elem.Doc: not part of the EU, but closely connected and currently without relevant national regulations. This element is a placeholder.

Elem.Name: ChemicalSafetyAssessmentInfo
Elem.Doc: Chemical safety assessment (CSA) carried out: To state if CSA has been performed on the substance or the individual substances of a mixture.

Elem.Name: ExposureScenario
Elem.Doc: Exposure scenarios for the mixture: To state if information on the actual use of the mixture, similar to information in an exposure scenario for a substance, is enclosed the SDS.

Elem.Name: AuthorisationNo
Elem.Doc: Authorisation number: For chemicals subject to authorisation according to REACH Annex XIV, which have been granted authorisation for the actual use.

Elem.Name: RestrictionsAccordingReach
Elem.Doc: Restricted in use according REACH: Restrictions on the chemical according to Annex XVII of REACH

Elem.Name: InciName
Elem.Doc: according to EU cosmetics regulation

Elem.Name: Detergents
Elem.Doc: Restrictions related to regulation on detergents:

Elem.Name: Voc
Elem.Doc: Restrictions related to the use of volatile organic compounds: Directive 2004/42/EC amending 1999/13/EC. This should be an exact value, not a range. But for reasons of ingredient nondisclosure, some companies decide to provide a range here.

Elem.Name: IndustrialEmissions
Elem.Doc: Directive 2010/75/EU This should be an exact value, not a range. But for reasons of ingredient nondisclosure, some companies decide to provide a range here.

Elem.Name: OtherEuLegislation
Elem.Doc: Other EU legislations: Miscellaneous restrictions etc. that apply to the chemical based on EU legislations – e.g. regulation on construction products.

Elem.Name: ExposureScenarioIdentificationString
Elem.Doc: Link to ESCom exposure scenario. The referenced exposure scenario(s) must be delivered in one or more separate file(s) in ESCom format. In its element ExposureScenario/IdentificationString, ESCom provides the UUID which is referenced here.

Elem.Name: VocValue
Elem.Doc: Voc contents: To be usually measured in g/L

Elem.Name: VocValue
Elem.Doc: Voc contents: To be usually measured in g/L

Elem.Name: NationalLegislationAndorra
Elem.Doc: not part of the EU, but closely connected and currently without relevant national regulations. This element is a placeholder.

Elem.Name: NationalLegislationAlbania
Elem.Doc: EU candidate

Elem.Name: NationalLegislationBosniaAndHerzegovina
Elem.Doc: not a EU member and witout chemicals law - except for the Srpska province, which aligns its safety data sheet to the EU.

Elem.Name: NationalLegislationSwitzerland
Elem.Doc: no EU member, but has its legislation widely aligned to EU law, thus accepts safety data sheets in EU format.

Elem.Name: NationalLegislationSpain
Elem.Doc: Includes the Canaries. Includes Ceuta and Melilla which are not part of the European Customs Union.

Elem.Name: NationalLegislationFrance
Elem.Doc: includes French Guayana, Guadeloupe, Martinique, Réunion, Mayotte and Saint Martin, which are not part of the European Customs Union.

Elem.Name: NationalLegislationUnitedKingdom
Elem.Doc: No EU member anymore after March 29, 2019. Until deviating legislation is established, the UK will be covered with a EU safety data sheet. Includes Gibraltar, which is not part of the European Customs Union.

Elem.Name: NationalLegislationIceland
Elem.Doc: not part of the EU, but chemical legislation aligned with EU legislation.

Elem.Name: ContentsOrIndexOfAnnexedEs

Elem.Name: AbbreviationsAndAcronymsUsed
Elem.Doc: Abbreviations and acronyms: Explanation of terms used in the SDS must be part of the SDS. This field should cover (additional) links to external sources for such lists, e.g. EChA Guidance or industry specific glossaries.

Elem.Name: VocLabelling
Elem.Doc: VOC Labelling: Labelling requirements according to directive 2004/42/EC (amending 1999/13/EC)

Elem.Name: DetergentLabelling
Elem.Doc: Detergent labelling: Labelling requirements according to detergents regulation (648/2004/EC with later amanedments). Includes dosing recommendations. Concentration groups: _lt 5 weight%, 5 - _lt 15 vekt%, 15 - _lt 30 weight%, og _ge 30 weight%.

Elem.Name: AerosolLabelling
Elem.Doc: Aerosol labelling: Labelling of aerosol dispensers in accordance with EU directive (75/324/EEC with later amendments)

Elem.Name: OtherEuLabellingRequirements
Elem.Doc: Other labelling requirenments in accordance with EU legislation: Labelling requirements imposed to the chemical in accordance with EU legislation not stated above.

Elem.Name: ProductSubcategory
Elem.Doc: Product Subcategory: The type of paint or varnish

Elem.Name: VocLimitForSubcategory
Elem.Doc: Maximum VOC content limit for the mixture: The maximum concentration of VOC in the actual product. To be given in grams per litre.

Elem.Name: MaxVocConcInMixture
Elem.Doc: Actual max. concentration in the mixture: The concentration of VOC in the mixture. To be given in grams per litre.

Elem.Name: OnLabel
Elem.Doc: Name of the component to be displayed on the hazard label: The value "True" for this means that the name of the actual component shall be printed on the hazard label as well as in section 2 of the SDS under the sub-heading 'Dangerous substances'�. The default value of this element will be 'false'�.
